fields.description:
An error occurred while trying to create the repository. The error reported by the server was:

Nothing else.
Here is what I get back from SourceTree while trying to create a remote repo. 
Sure I logged in.
Sure I checked the password many times. It is correct. 
Sure I have a valid account (AppleMax) on Bitbucket. 

Hope it is possible to solve it soon as it may affect the workflow since Monday, 22nd.
fields.summary: error logging in to Bitbucket over SourceTree

fields.description:
Error log:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree -c "gpg.program=/Users/norio/Applications/SourceTree\ Beta.app/Contents/Resources/bin/stgpg.sh" commit -q --gpg-sign=D4A7318EB7F7138D -F /var/folders/kt/2mwy9b_56_7993x190pl_1fh0000gn/T/SourceTreeTemp.nuJ2RM

error: could not run gpg.
fatal: failed to write commit object
Completed with errors, see above
{noformat}
fields.summary: Signing git commit fails with error "error: cannot run /Applications/SourceTree\ Beta.app/Contents/Resources/bin/stgpg.sh: No such file or directory"

fields.description:
From STSP-4930:

Open Bitbucket. Click External Diff on a file. Click any other window to hide Bitbucket and the External diff behind some other window. When you try to click back to Bitbucket, the open dialog from the external diff is preventing either window from coming into the background. Click on the icon for the window does nothing because Bitbucket is locked and the external diff window is a different icon. This is seriously ammature. I get that you can update the files when editing is done, but you could take a play from Tortoise software and stop doing this. When you click on an icon in the taskbar, it should switch to that window immediately no matter what dialogs are popped up.
fields.summary: Clicking External Diff causes permanent freezing on Mac

fields.description:
When I click the "Edit Config File..." button in the "Remotes" or "Advanced" tabs of the "Repository Settings... ⇧⌘," dialog, the "config" file is always opened with TextEdit.app.  I'd like SourceTree to open this and other files with a different editor, MacVim.  I've tried changing this behavior by setting the git config "core.editor" to "/usr/local/bin/mvim", but it makes no difference.

Apparently, TextEdit is hard-coded into SourceTree.  Please make it an option the user can change, either in the SourceTree preferences or the git configuration.
fields.summary: Let user choose config file editor

fields.description: I would love to see a possibility to add a repo when filtering on a repository group. (i.e. Dragging a folder into the filtered group)
fields.summary: Add repository while filtering on a group

fields.description: *Note:* this affects 2.4b4, not 2.4b1; but there's no 2.4b4 option on the "Affects Version/s" combo.
fields.summary: Spacebar no longer stages/unstages files

fields.description: Option has no effect, commits merge immediately even when "Commit merge immediately" is unchecked.
fields.summary: Commit merge immediately option ignored

fields.description:
If you select two branches for comparison and choose the tree view you'll find that periodically the tree view is recreated, resetting your position and re-expanding all levels.  If you are working with a large set of file diffs this can be frustrating.

I realize this may be a difficult problem to solve in general allowing for arbitrary changes coming from the filesystem, but in the common case it seems like this could be handled better.  At minimum it would be nice if the tree view remembered which nodes were expanded/collapsed and tried to maintain that. 

thanks.
fields.summary: SourceTree rebuilds compare branch tree view on background refresh

fields.description:
In the "Description" column of the "History" view, each commit has a single line on which to show:

 
 * The tags and branches referring to a commit. 
 
 * The commit message. 
 

In some of our repositories, we have a large number of tags and branches referring to a single commit (_e.g._, ten or more), so they run off the end of the column.

Because I can't scroll the Description column horizontally, the only way to view the full set of tags and branches is to widen the Source Tree window on a large monitor.

The "commit" pane below the history _does_ show the list of "LABELS," but it's not horizontally scrollable.

These ideas pop into my head about how to respond, but I make no claim that any of them are good:

 
 * If the user hovers over a commit, pop up a window that shows the commit message and all the branches and tags. 
 
 * In the right-click menu for a commit, include an option to bring up a "summary" window that shows the commit message and all the branches and tags. 
 
 * Make the "commit" pane horizontally scrollable. 
 
 * In the "commit" pane, show the labels one-per-line, and make the pane vertically scrollable (perhaps it already is).
fields.summary: Make it easier to see lots of tags and branches referring to a commit.

fields.description:
i want my clients to receive updates by pulling a project from git, using their own credentials (which have read-only authorization on a bitbucket project). I don't mind if a user and password have to be entered each time.

however sometimes I want to make changes at the client's workstation, and push them with my personal credentials (which are read/write on bitbucket).

I configured my project URL to be without username, and I configured .git/config with the blank credential helper file as per [http://stackoverflow.com/a/36435803]. From the git command line, pushing and pulling has the correct behavior that user and password are prompted each time for pulling and pushing.  But sourcetree is very persistent to store credentials, so after pull/push I have to go each time to the network preferences and delete the username, otherwise my credentials get stored.

To address this, I would like an option either that credentials are never stored, or some finer control such as "always ask for credentials when pushing" or some such.  I notice that the push always includes "credential.helper=sourcetree" parameter, it seems like an option to remove this might do the job.
fields.summary: more control over sourcetree credential store

fields.description:
When trying to refresh the remote tab in Sourcetree i get the following message:
"
Login failed for your Bitbucket account.

The remote service said: 'The operation couldn’t be completed. (SDNetDomain error 7.)
'
"

Please note that everything is working well in the git cli

any idea what could cause this issue ? 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Fail to work on SourceTree with my Mac

fields.description: Should a user switch to 'Current branch' view and change the branch, the view always defaults to 'All branches'. This is highly inconvenient since 'Current branch' is the default view I (and my team) need. Is there a way to make Sourcetree keep whatever view option you had or introduce a default setting for this?
fields.summary: OS X: Default branch view always changing to 'All branches' when switching branch

fields.description:
I click on a commit and choose from the repositories menu the Interactive rebase.
I get an empty error dialog, saying "errors during merge" and no details. 
Tried to attach screenshot png file , but getting error saying:
Kira could not attach the files as there was a missing token.

I have no uncommitted changes.

After merging the branch to the master branch, the problem was fixed, and I can enter interactive rebase.
fields.summary: Can not do Interactive Rebase and error not showing anything
Homework3

fields.description: A new file added in a branch shows up in a comparison as a deletion of all lines in the file.  I expected that "reverse hunk" would create the file if needed but it fails.  If this worked it would be a convenient way to cherry pick individual files from a branch.
fields.summary: Reverse Hunk should create a file if needed...

fields.description:
Our entire team is experiencing this several times a week for last several releases. For some reason, occassionaly all remotes will get suddenly reset to the same URL.

For example, I may have the following one day:
dbreese=https://abc.com/dbreese/Repo
origin=https://abc.com/master/Repo

Then I go to push my branch changes to dbreese, but they never show up. After some investigation, I realize that dbreese now has the same url as origin (https://abc.com/master/Repo).

This causes a lot of headaches, especially if we've accidentally pushed into master on origin.

No idea what triggers this issue.
fields.summary: SourceTree keeps resetting all remote URLs to origin's value.

fields.description:
Log viewer validation needs bounds check.

http://crashes.to/s/0fd7243758c
fields.summary: Fabric Crash Report #939 - log viewer validation

fields.description:
Path watcher bounds checking (decomposed character diff)

http://crashes.to/s/1214a49cf73
fields.summary: Fabric Crash Report #929 - path watcher

fields.description:
I have been using BBEdit as my external diff but it is not possible to tell it to ignore whitespace when it is launched from SourceTree.

I have tried setting the visual diff tool to "Other..." and then putting bbdiff and $REMOTE $LOCAL in the boxes, but while this does create the temp file for comparing, it does not seem to do anything else. Certainly, it does not diff in BBEdit. It fails regardless of whether I add "--ignore-spaces" or any other args like "--wait --reverse --resume".

Is there a way to make this happen, please? Thanks.

 

Also, this is marked as "Minor" now and I can understand that it might seem so - unless you are the person trying to figure out what the actual change was in a file that has been reformatted.  Code reviews become exponentially harder.  Thanks for whatever attention this can get - or even a hint about how a workaround could be done using bbdiff and the "Other..." menu choice.
fields.summary: BBEdit as external diff could ignore spaces

fields.description: I often lose the Repository Browser in the various windows I have on screen at any given time. It would be nice to be able to have it always available as a Menubar application. Bonus points if it could launch on startup.
fields.summary: Repository Browser from the Menubar

fields.description:
I upgrade from source old veison.
Then I got this error. No log available
fields.summary: Git log failed with code 4

fields.description:
At times the description can be quite long with all the tags associated with a commit. Wrapping this field in the the pane showing Graph, Description, Date, Commit, etc. would be quite helpful.
(Or perhaps placing the tag in separate column, so the commit description is less likely to be cut off for a given column width.)
fields.summary: Wrap Commit Descriptions

fields.description:
Hi,

I am not sure if it's a bug or feature, but when I have stashed some some changes with some untracked files - command used - `git stash -u`
 then in source tree I select this Stash, but I am not able to see changes from untracked files, I can see only changes from files which exists already in repo.

With my git CLI i can preview changes using 
 git show stash@\{0}^3
 command, however if there are no changes in untracked files it will return fatal error.

It's just a suggestion, that it would be nice to see changes from untracked files which were stashed.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Repository stash preview doesn't include untracked files
Crashlytics logs out of control

fields.description: Git clone in source tree gui does not include detailed progress info on underlying process. However git clone on terminal displays percentage completion of network operation gives valid incites on the progress.
fields.summary: Add progress display for cloning

fields.description:
Would love the ability to directly open an Xcode Workspace (xcworkspace) or xcodeproj
For bonus points - make those shortcuts scriptable so people can customize sourcetree to the program they use. 

The code is pretty easy to do in swift - if you have that portion of the Mac app open - I am happy to submit a pull request.
fields.summary: Allow us to Customize the Short cut icons in the top right hand corner

fields.description:
When you choose to push changes and under Advanced changes which branch to push, the preview in Outgoing changes does not reflect the selected branch (i.e. it looks as if all changes would be pushed).

Similarly, when pulling and selecting a branch, Incoming changes does not update.
fields.summary: Outgoing changes is not updated when changing branch

fields.summary: Terminal button crashes SourceTree with fatal error

fields.description: It would it be nice  have an option for Sourcetree to not automatically track remote branches when "Push branches" is set to "current”.
fields.summary: Disable automatic tracking of pushed branches

fields.description:
This is a veeeeery small feature request, which helps when switching between monitors.

When resizing the SourceTree Window, the Commit Text Input Pane resizes proportionally in height. 

When I work on a big screen, I have the Commit Text Input Pane usually in a height for showing 3 rows. When I plug off my macbook from the monitor, and continue working on the go, the SourceTree window resizes, and resizes the Commit Text Input Pane proportionally. It would be better if the Commit Text Input Pane height would not scale when scaling the SourceTree window, because also on the smaller monitor, I need my 3 rows.

The inverse is also true: when on the small monitor, I resize the Commit Text Input Pane to a sensible height, and I connect to the bigger monitor, the height increases, even though I don't need it that big.


It's a bit hard to describe, but a very simple thing that would help in the daily work, and probably won't be too much effort in implementation.
fields.summary: Resizing Behavior of the Commit Text Pane

fields.description:
It would really helpful if the diffs in Sourcetree would highlight the specific changes on the lines that changed. 

This is being done in Bitbucket. For example, in [this commit|https://bitbucket.org/jespern/django-piston/commits/c9fe89f3ec791e481d37221fec20a6dd868527a6], some lines have been modified. For those modified lines, the specific changes in those lines are highlighted. This is a really cool feature of bitbucket and would be really useful in Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Highlight the differences in a diff for modified lines, just like Bitbucket's diff viewer

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:

1. Create a new branch called {{feature/some_long_feature_name}} (or use git flow to create a new feature called {{some_long_feature_name}}).
 2. Open the Repository Browser.

Unless the Repository Browser is wide enough, both the repo name and the important part of the branch name are obscured.

Expected behavior:
 * The repo name should resist compression with a required priority (it should always appear)
 * The branch label should truncate from the beginning or middle, not the end
 * The branch label should truncate characters (replacing with {{…}}) instead of truncating whole words
fields.summary: Long git flow branch names don't render well

fields.description:
I have over 250 branches in my repo hosted locally mirrored on Origin. 
As shown in the attached screenshot, branches on Origin display properly, but local branches do not display at all.
The commit history on the repo is fine.
Is there a hard limit on how many branches SourceTree will display?
I have reset the git index but that has had no effect.
Loading the repo into other GUI git clients (e.g. GitKraken) shows all branches and everything works, so it seems unlikely that there's an actual problem with the repo itself.
fields.summary: Local branches not displaying

fields.description:
From STSP-4762:

"After updating Mac OS X to version 10.11.6, label text is misaligned as shown in the screenshot. This issue became apparent immediately after upgrading to 10.11.6. I am using SourceTree 2.3.1."
fields.summary: Git labels are messed up after updating to Mac OS X 10.11.6

fields.description: Crash Log from SourceTree 2.3.1 crashing when staging files:  [^SourceTree_2016-07-26-185425_iMac-Mac.crash]
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.3.1 crashes when staging files

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "Open..." and "Show Repository Browser" menu items both seem to have the _Command+O_ shortcut.
 !Open.PNG|thumbnail!  !ShowRepositoryBrowser.PNG|thumbnail! 
After triggers the shortcut, "Open..." function seems to have higher priority, so user unable to use it for "Show Repository Browser" function.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Press _Command + O_

h3. Expected Results
Can only trigger one function - _*Open...*_ function

h3. Actual Results
Have a different keyboard shortcut to trigger different function.
fields.summary: "Open..." and "Show Repository Browser" function shares same keyboard shortcut

fields.description:
This happens in 2.4 (73) for Mac. Works fine in 2.3.1.

Let's say you have commits:

D (newest)

C

B

A (oldest)

And you rebase interactively on A. In the 'Reorder and amend commits' window you'll see:

D
C
B

If you select D and click on 'Squash with previous' you'll get:

[2 commits]
__C
__D
B

And then you select [2 commits] and click on squash again:

[3 commits]
__D
__B
C

The order of the squashed commits is messed up in every step.

Thanks
fields.summary: Squash with previous in interactive rebase wrong order

fields.description: staging a file in treeview autoscrolls up to the top. This is annoying when you want to only stage certain files and ignore others as you constantly have to keep rescrolling back down to where you were.
fields.summary: Staging Files in Treeview

fields.description: https://fabric.io/sourcetree/mac/apps/com.torusknot.sourcetreenotmas/issues/5791c8c3ffcdc042502fd6e3
fields.summary: Fabric Crash report #873 - [STRepoBrowserWindowController insertNewNode:parent:atChildIndex:]

fields.description:
When I have a conflict during a merge, the conflicting files show up with a little warning sign under "unstaged files". When I click one, it shows me a diff, but the conflicting lines are hidden among lots of successfully merged lines. It'd be great if

1) conflict markers (<<<<<<<< HEAD etc.) were highlighted in a special color (e.g. printed in red and bold, or even shown in a special way in the diff to make it easier to see what the two parts are, e.g. by showing the code ranges from the conflicting branches wrapped in their own boxes and slightly inset at the edges)

2) there was a "Go to next conflict" arrow somewhere at the top of the pane that allowed quickly scrolling to the conflicting part of the file.
fields.summary: When viewing an unstaged file that has conflicts, offer "jump to next conflict"
Add keyboard shortcut to switch between current branch and all branch display

fields.description: If you have a text cursor (i.e. empty selection) in the commit message field and type Cmd-C, instead of nothing happening ("Copy" shouldn't be enabled when nothing is selected) the clipboard is emptied instead. Given C and V are right next to each other on many keyboards, it's easy to lose data. Please fix this to leave the pasteboard alone.
fields.summary: Copying an empty selection nukes the clipboard content
Ignore Dialog Option: Exact File incl. Path

fields.description:
Stashes are not sorted newest (top) to oldest (bottom). This happens in 2.4 (73) for Mac. Works fine in 2.3.1.

The behaviour is a bit weird: my currently newest stash (let's call it A) is shown at the bottom (as if it were the oldest), if I create a new stash (B), A is moved to the top (where it should've been from the start), if I then delete B, A is moved back to the bottom.

Thanks
fields.summary: Stashes not sorted newest (top) to oldest (bottom)

fields.description: I was trying to clone a repository from a URL that had an extra space at the end when I copied/pasted. It would be great if the app could strip any leading and trailing spaces from the url string before processing.
fields.summary: Strip leading and trailing spaces when cloning from URL

fields.description:
I am constantly getting a request for my GitHub token key. The popup says "Password" but I use a token key. This happens quite often when you guys update the program. Whenever I download and install a new version, this often happens.

I am so frustrated with this.
fields.summary: SourceTree constantly asks for my GitHub credential

fields.description: When take the "reset xxx to this commit" action and the commit message is very long, the dialog will be too wide to displayed in the screen (the OK button will be out of the screen). Because in the "To commit" line in the dialog, all of commit message will be displayed and will not wrap, the dialog will be as long as the commit message. The solution is wrapping line if the commit message is too long or simply displayed part of the commit message with an ellipsis or use a text field with a vertical scrollbar.
fields.summary: Dialog are too wide when take the "reset xxx to this commit" action
Customer report: Follow renamed files not showing history

fields.description: Every time I try to open my project clicking on Terminal button, SourceTree crashes. Although it opens the terminal window, it's open in my HOME directory instead of project one.
fields.summary: Crashing when opening Terminal (iTerm2) on MacOSX 10.11.5

fields.description:
Need bounds checking and API touchups around repo browser mutation.

https://fabric.io/sourcetree/mac/apps/com.torusknot.sourcetreenotmas/issues/57319cc9ffcdc042509bd93d
fields.summary: Fabric Crash Report #39 - repo browser children

fields.description:
I love working with SourceTree. The only thing that keeps bugging me is the fact that I'm always looking for the window containing the repository I'm working on.
Usually I have three to four repositories open at the same time. This along with 10 other apps makes the screen layout messy to say the least. 
Having all of SourceTree in one application window with quick repository switching (tabs anyone?) would make a huge increase to my productivity.
fields.summary: Single window support for working with multiple repositories on osx

fields.description:
when reviewing files changes ("File Status"), the right pane shows the diff in terms of 'Hunks'.
 when there are a lot of changes made in the same file, the filename might be scrolled away.
 It will be useful to be able to know which hunk associated to which filename.
fields.summary: keep showing filenames while scrolling files diff (right pane)

fields.description:
When creating a new branch, the Current Branch text field has text selection disabled.
When branching from something named similar to *features-username/branch-name*  it would be helpful if we could select & copy parts of the current branch name for creating the new branch.
fields.summary: Enable copy of Current Branch name when creating a new branch

fields.description: When every I open a new repository window the sidebar is hidden.  This is a new bug that only appeared in version 2.3.1.
fields.summary: Sidebar is always hidden

fields.summary: Fabric Crash Report #67 - search results

fields.description:
The current History/Log view shows *all* changesets -- as expected.

This can be overwhelming when I'm working on different things in my tree, and I'm only interested in whatever patches I'm working on locally, which may get lost in the history after a few pulls.

To help clarify things, it would be great if you offered a "WIP" view when the log only shows local patches, and their descendants (for context).

As an example, "hg wip" does just that on the command line, by using a few built-in log customizations:
http://jordi.inversethought.com/blog/customising-mercurial-like-a-pro/
That web page shows in details how it is done, so I would hope you should be able to re-use some of these techniques in SourceTree.

And/or you could add that functionality in the "Search" view, so you could display all changesets that are found, along with their descendants (in lighter color) for context.

Thank you, and good luck!
fields.summary: Filter history/log view to only show work-in-progress and parents

fields.description: 'Cmd + B' doesn't show the main window (the repo list view) anymore.
fields.summary: 'Cmd + B' shortcut not working anymore

fields.description: I realize it's a beta (macOS) but figured I'd report this for you should you need compatibility with Sierra down the road.  All seems to work fine the only notable issue is when I open a repo the left pane is always hidden (shows branches, etc.).
fields.summary: On Mac OS Sierra BETA 1 - left pane does not remember it's state (visible)

fields.description: Every time SourceTree is started, the sidebar is hidden. After opening a new window, I open the sidebar, the close SourceTree. After reopening, the sidebar is still closed. Other window related settings are saved, such as window size/position, and the various pane sizing.
fields.summary: Sidebar hidden by default on macOS Sierra

fields.description:
When trying to delete a non tracked (or even a tracked file), that does not works.
SourceTree reload the view but files are still there.
fields.summary: Removing a file doesn't work on some file systems

fields.description: Installed the update today and every time I do anything in SourceTree the performance is awful: processors at full power for five to ten seconds.
fields.summary: Very poor performance

fields.description:
Selecting a commit with a list of changed files which is longer than the viewable area should be entirely scrollable so that all items in the list are visible. However the panel providing the list of changes and attached scrollbar appears to be taller than the application window. This means I can drag the scrollbar below the bottom edge of the application window, and ultimately means I am unable to see items at the bottom of the list. I can see more of the list if I maximise the panel height, but at some point I run out of pixels. If a select a list element and then use arrow-keys I can explore the individual file diffs, so there is clearly items down there to be viewed.

See attached image, noting the partially obscured scrollbar.
fields.summary: Commit change list panel exceeds visible/scrollable area

fields.description:
There should be a shortcut to open All Repositories (Dashboard) window.
From previous SourceTree versions I got used to ⌘B but it's no longer working in beta.
Workaround: hit ⌘N (but it will also bring up new repos dropdown).
fields.summary: Shortcut for All Repositories (SourceTree window) is missing
Make tree representations similar to what "man git-rebase" shows

fields.summary: Crash on opening iTerm 3.

fields.description:

fields.summary: Crash when using Submodule

fields.description:
Automatic "[groupname]/repo name/alias" in the title bar would be kinda awesome.
Something like 
* [GroupName] reponame/repoalias
* groupname/reponame
fields.summary: Include groupname in title bar

fields.description:
Trying to run stree now gives the error:

Objective-C garbage collection is no longer supported.

and quits.
fields.summary: stree command line tool no longer runs on macOS Sierra

fields.description:
When having changed several source code file I browse to them in source tree "commit" window to add comment and upload. However often I need to click the focus in and out of the commit window in order for source tree to see that there have been changes. 

It is reproducible each time. So either a training issue for me or bug for you
fields.summary: File list does not appear when 'modified' chosen in commit windown

fields.description:
With Sourcetree 2.3.1 on OSX Yosemite when prompted prompted for a bitbucket password if the password contains the = character, it is not saved correctly in the keychain (only the characters preceding = are saved). 

This results in being prompted for a password repeatedly (as the saved password is not correct)

Changing to a password without the = character immediately fixed the issue
fields.summary: Passwords containing = character are not saved correctly to Mac OSX Keychain

fields.description:
When I restart SourceTree it has became unable to open my HG project.
It says nothing.. just showing a wheel .. that goes on endless.
fields.summary: Cannot open HG projects any more

fields.description: With git flow if you start a feature and name it "blabla get/set something" the display of the branches gets visually broken
fields.summary: Slash in gitflow feature name confuses sourcetree

fields.description:
The `CMD-O` shortcut is mapped to both "FIle -> Open File..." and "Window -> Show repository browser".

Needless to say, only one of them works, in this case Open file. Therefore, there is currently no functional keyboard shortcut to open the repository browser.
fields.summary: CMD-O shortcut is mapped to two different actions

fields.description: We have a repo with over 10000 (not a typo, actually ten thousand) branches. As you can imagine anything that is related to branches is quite hard to work with, so there needs to be some improvements in the workflow related to them. For example anywhere where branch selection is involved.
fields.summary: Improve workflow with a lot of branches

fields.description:
When a new Local Repository is create there is an option to create also a remote one.
The remote repository is created so until now everything is fine but I have to go manually to copy the link from the website from the new created repository and put it in the new local repository as the "origin".
I suppose that if I create a "local new repository" and I check "create also remote" the local one shall be already connected to the remote one.
fields.summary: Origin remote not added

fields.description:
I like the new version of SourceTree, but coming from Github Desktop, the thing I miss most is the ease of navigating between different repositories without having to open a new window for the repository browser and for each of the opened repositories.

Especially when working on several repo's at once, it can get really messy and I end up having 5-6 different SourceTree windows open with no easy way of telling which is which.

Can we get the option of having an embedded sidebar for navigating our repositories and when switching, have SourceTree recycle the same window for all repositories?
fields.summary: Sidebar for navigating repositories and recycle main window

fields.description:
When I right click on a branch in Sidebar and select "Create Pull Request" but I have not yet pushed the branch to the remote repository, SourceTree doesn't give any feedback, doesn't create the pull request.

It would be great if SourceTree could at least tell me that I need to push the branch.
fields.summary: Create Pull Request does nothing if the branch is pushed to the remote repository
Bookmark shortcut not working (Cmd+B)

fields.description: The "Show Repository Browser" shortcut has changed from CMD+B to CMD+O with one of the latest releases. But CMD+O is reserved by "Open...", which makes the key binding useless. Please change it back to CMD+B.
fields.summary: The "Show Repository Browser" shortcut has changed from CMD+B to CMD+O with one of the latest releases. But CMD+O is reserved by "Open...".

fields.description: Have you at least launched the SourceTree application at least once before releasing it?
fields.summary: Seriously?

fields.description: Monitor cooperation of NASA, ESA and JAXA&
fields.summary: Monitor NASA Mars Programme

fields.description:
I often have multiple repository windows open on my machine (Mac).

I would like the option to color a repositories window so make it easier to tell them apart at a glance when context switching.
fields.summary: Options for different colors when multiple repository windows are open

fields.description: Luckily GitHub is supported so that I can maintain my projects on my account, but my company uses Gitlab, and from what I can see Gitlab isn't currently supported. For now, I can only use SourceTree for personal use because of this, but I would really like to use it for my company. If Gitlab becomes supported, I will be able to uninstall the other Git client I use (SmartGit) and solely use SourceTree as the Git client for both personal and company-related projects.
fields.summary: GitLab support

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. init new git repo with "git init test" command
2. enter repo dir and create test file with "cd test && touch test.txt" command
3. open created repo in SourceTree
4. go to File Status under Workspace
5. from File Status screen stage newly created file
6.  from File Status screen commit newly created file
7. press CMD+Z combination

Result: app is crashed
Expected: nothing happens

fields.summary: SourceTree crashes after making commit and pushing CMD+Z

fields.description: When clicking on the Terminal toolbar button, SourceTree crashes.
fields.summary: Crash clicking on Terminal toolbar button

fields.description: A long, long time ago, SourceTree would show both the old version and new version for binary files with a valid QuickView (eg. images). Now, it only shows the After, and the Before always displays "No Preview Available". There is a button labeled "Open" underneath it that does nothing.
fields.summary: No Preview Available in side-by-side diff for binary files

fields.description: Everytime that we open the application the *.gitconfig* file from *$HOME* changed. Right now is adding some *path=* under the *[difftool "sourcetree"]* section.
fields.summary: Changed the gitconfig everytime you open the application

fields.description: When doing interactive rebase and editing the commit messages, the window is tiny and can't be resized, making it quite hard to type anything in there....
fields.summary: Make the commit message window bigger and resizable

fields.description:
I'm using descriptive branch names, using some of the Git workflow concepts (feature branches, etc.). As a result, the names can become quite long and I need to resize the sidebar to be able to read them in full.

However, when I close that window and re-open it again, the sidebar is back to it's too-small default width.

Request is to restore the width of the sidebar as I have left it.
fields.summary: Remember the width of the sidebar when I resize it

fields.description:
*Adding an emoji to a commit title makes the commit text field look weird when opening it again.*

The steps to reproduce are pretty simple:

1. Create a commit message with an emoji (from the Mac's keyboard, not the :emoji: format from GitHub)
2. Commit
3. Open commit window again and start typing the new message. The text field's font changes, looking weird, with huge spaces between words and other formatting issues.

The issue occurs until I restart the app or reopen the repository window.

I've added screenshots of the first commit with an emoji and how the next commits look.
I was able to reproduce it using the latest version (2.3.x), but I didn't try with the older ones.
fields.summary: Adding an emoji to a commit breaks the text field

fields.description:
Deleting a Submodule from SourceTree removes the line in .gitmodules file but it does not:
* Remove the data in .git/config
* Remove the cached path in the index (git rm --cached submodule_path)
* Remove the cached data in .git/modules

Some users would like to have the option to delete all 3 above when removing a Submodule from SourceTree.
fields.summary: Remove a submodule completely when deleting it from SourceTree

fields.description:
Steps to replicate

1. Add an Github account
2. Open *Repository browser* window
3. Click in *Remote tab*
4. Notice that all the starred repos are pulled from Github
fields.summary: [Github] Pull starred repos on Remote tab in Repository browser window

fields.description:
https://fabric.io/sourcetree/mac/apps/com.torusknot.sourcetreenotmas/issues/574e0bc8ffcdc04250a5a881

Bounds check missing when verifying account supports git.
fields.summary: Fabric Crash Report #373 - create remote account
